abstract.para: An Ansible playbook is a YAML file that defines a series of tasks to be executed on one or more hosts. This topic covers creating a simple playbook.

step.para: Set up SSH key-based authentication from the control node to each managed node.
Generate a key pair on the control node.
It is recommended to use a dedicated SSH key and clearly defined in the variable ansible_ssh_private_key_file.
Copy the public key to the managed node.
This one-time setup allows Ansible to connect securely without prompting for credentials during automation.
